properties.areaDesc: Yellowstone National Park; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 8:15PM MST until February 8 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...More Significant Snow for Far Western Wyoming...

.Another storm system will bring another round of moderate to
heavy snow to far western Wyoming late tonight and especially on
Saturday. Significant blowing snow is also expected in the
mountains.

* WHAT...Periods of snow, heavy at times. Total snow accumulations
of 6 to 12 inches. Areas of blowing snow especially on ridge
tops and open areas.

* WHERE...Yellowstone National Park, Teton and Gros Ventre
Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 PM Saturday. The heaviest
snow is expected during the day on Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor the Bridger-Teton Avalanche
Center at JHAVALANCHE.ORG, if your plans include travel into
the back country.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST SATURDAY
